TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit CodeLinePragma extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a specific location within a specific file.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeLinePragma> can be used to represent a specific location within a file. This type of object is often used after compilation by debugging tools to store locations of associated code elements, such as position references associated with compiler warnings and errors.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of the <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeLinePragma> class to reference a specific line of a source file.
[!code-cpp[CodeDomSampleBatch#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/CodeDomSampleBatch/CPP/class1.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[CodeDomSampleBatch#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/CodeDomSampleBatch/CS/class1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[CodeDomSampleBatch#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/CodeDomSampleBatch/VB/class1.vb#2)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks If you use this constructor you should also set the <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeLinePragma.LineNumber%2A> and <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeLinePragma.FileName%2A> properties.

The line number to store a reference to.
